Emboar (Japanese: エンブオー Enbuoh) is a dual-type Fire/Fighting Pokémon introduced in Generation V.

It evolves from Pignite starting at level 36. It is the final form of Tepig.

Biology

Emboar is a bulky, bipedal Pokémon with pig-like features. It has a red nose, large bushy black eyebrows, and two tusks protruding from its lower jaw. Constantly burning flames cover the front of its neck and shoulders. The fire beard comes from the body flame within its body. It has short legs and thick arms. Its arms have orange upper portions while the legs have red upper portions. All of its limbs have black lower portions with thin yellow lines where the upper and lower colors meet. These lines are straight on the arms and spiked on the legs. The arms have red lines around the wrists and tufts of fur on the elbows. The hands are tipped with three claws, while the feet have two claws. A large, dark horizontal stripe on the chest of Emboar has swirled yellow markings. Its small tail ends in a tuft of hair.

Using the wreath of flames on its neck and shoulders, Emboar will set its hands on fire. It uses its power and speed to master fighting moves. This power can be increased when Emboar's neck flame intensifies. The more dire the situation is, the more excited Emboar becomes to the point of enjoying itself. Though very tough and relentless when fighting, it shows deep affection for those it considers friends. It can also unleash powerful blasts of fire using only its nose and cloak its body in a fire to use many powerful attacks.

Prior to Generation VIII, Emboar and its pre-evolved forms were the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Heat Crash.

Evolution

Emboar evolves from Pignite and is the final form of Tepig.

(For specifics on this Pokémon's Evolution in the games, refer to Game data→Evolution data.)

In animation

Main series

Major appearances

Bianca's Emboar

Emboar made his animated series debut in Search for the Clubultimate!, under the ownership of Bianca.

Other

Emboar debuted in White—Victini and Zekrom and Black—Victini and Reshiram, under the ownership of Tatsuki. It battled and lost to Ash's Oshawott during Eindoak Town's Harvest Festival battle tournament. Iris's Emolga also battled the Mega Fire Pig Pokémon, but Emolga used Volt Switch and sent out Excadrill instead, causing Iris's loss since substitutions were not allowed during the tournament battles.

In Evolution by Fire!, Shamus's Emboar and Heatmor faced off against Ash's Tepig and Snivy in a Double Battle. It eventually ended when Tepig evolved into Pignite, which single-handedly defeated both.

Minor appearances

An Emboar appeared in Mission: Find Oinkologne's Partner!.

Pokémon Black 2 and White 2 Animated Trailer

In the Pokémon Black Version 2 and Pokémon White Version 2 Animated Trailer, Nate owns an Emboar, which he obtained as his first partner Pokémon from Bianca. It was first shown as Nate was about to battle Elesa.

In the manga

Be the Best! Pokémon B+W

Cheren was seen with an Emboar in The Birth of the Best Pokémon Trainer!.

Movie adaptations

Tatsuki owns an Emboar in White—Victini and Zekrom.

Pocket Monsters B2 W2 ~ A New Legend ~

Hiro owns an Emboar, which he sent out to prevent Team Plasma from getting away with Keldeo.

Pocket Monsters BW: The Heroes of Fire and Thunder

Main article: Shin's Emboar

Shin owns an Emboar.

Pokémon Adventures

Main article: Bo

Black owns an Emboar, nicknamed Bo. He evolved in Museum Showdown.

Pokémon RéBURST

Carola has an Emboar, which she can use as a Burst form.

In the TCG

Main article: Emboar (TCG)

Trivia

  • Emboar, Samurott, and Serperior all share the same base stat total of 528.
  • In some games, the Pokédex states that Emboar can "throw a fire punch". However, this was first said in Pokémon Black, while Emboar was unable to learn the move Fire Punch until Pokémon Black 2 and White 2.
    • In the Japanese version of the Pokédex entries, the "fire punch" is written as 「ほのおの パンチ」 (in the kanji version, the equivalent is 「炎の パンチ」). Except for the addition of a space, this is almost the same as 「ほのおのパンチ」 (the Japanese name of Fire Punch). Similarly, the English Pokédex text mentions "fire punch" in lowercase, while moves like "Fire Punch" are written in title case instead.
  • Emboar appears in Pokémon Battle Chess BW Version. Along with Victini, it is the only piece that has its power raised when damaged. Also, along with Zoroark, Emboar doesn't behave like any traditional piece in chess.

Origin

Emboar is based on a boar. Additionally, Ken Sugimori has said that Tepig, Pignite, and Emboar were designed in a Chinese style, specifically mentioning the character of Zhang Fei from Romance of the Three Kingdoms as Emboar's inspiration.[1] Zhang Fei was assassinated by his own subordinates, and had his head severed and presented for the opposing faction, which may be alluded to in Emboar's design, as its head is "separated" from its body by a wreath of fire. The wreath of fire also resembles a cape or a scarf. Emboar may also be based on Zhu Bajie, a pig demon from the Chinese tale Journey to the West. Serperior, Emboar, and Samurott's evolutionary lines are collectively based on Western, Chinese, and Japanese culture respectively, to represent the diversity of the Unova region.[1]

Appearance-wise, Emboar looks much like a wild boar with elements of a British Saddleback in a wrestling singlet. The swirl pattern around its abdomen resembles the patterns on a ding or ancient Greek pottery.

Emboar's Fighting typing might be a reference to war pigs, more specifically incendiary pigs, a form of ancient warfare reported by a couple of Greek military writers.

Name origin

Emboar may be a combination of ember, emperor, and boar.

Enbuoh may be a combination of 炎 en (flame), 豚 buta (pig), 武 bu (martial arts), ブー bū (oink), 王 ō (king), and possibly ember and boar.

In other languages

Language Title Meaning
Japanese エンブオー Enbuoh From 炎 en, 豚 buta or 武 bu, 王 ō, and possibly ember and boar
French Roitiflam From roi, rôti, and flamme
Spanish Emboar Same as English name
German Flambirex From flambieren and Rex
Italian Emboar Same as English name
Korean 염무왕 Yeommuwang From 염 (炎) yeom, 무 (武) mu, and 왕 (王) wang
Mandarin Chinese 炎武王 Yánwǔwáng From 炎 yán, 武 wǔ, and 王 wáng
Cantonese Chinese 炎武王 Yìhmmóuhwòhng From 炎 yìhm, 武 móuh, and 王 wòhng
More languages
Hindi फ़ायविलॉर्ड Fiyveelord From fire and lord
Russian Эмбор Embor Transcription of English name
Thai เอ็นบูโอ Enbuo Transcription of Japanese name
